page.title: 08ST.KATHARINE'S CHURCH
page.content: The earliest record of the church dates back to 1388; it was a chantry endowed for masses for the dead. The chantry was dismantled at the dissolution of the monasteries. Most of the present church was built during the reign of Elizabeth I. There are still traces of the 14th. century tower and much Elizabethan work remains. In 1766 the church was enlarged and in 1905 the chancel and nave were rebuilt. The clock on the tower was erected in memory of the dead of the 1939-45 World War. The church, standing on the highest part of the ridge on which Blackrod was built, is a landmark for many miles around.
